column83: description
The Broken Sphere
It is named for the great amount of fighting that is done within the sphere.
It is named for the great oceans that lie within space itself.
The sphere of the Dark Sun campign
It is named due to the greater spelljamming capabilities ships recieve upon entering it.
Sphere half-full of water, near Vodoni Empire
Horrorspace was once called peacespace. It's current name is due to the fact that Clockwork Horros devouered the entire innards of the sphere.
It is named for the state that all the planets are in... torn up.
Origin of Clockwork Horrors
Filled with viscous fluid, hostle inhabitants.
It is named due to the Elemental nature of its planets.

Tarraspace is a sphere in which almost all normal magic, psionics, elements and even conventional physics has broken down. Antimatter particles swirl in the central area where once a solar body existed, and the sole habitable surviving planet is infested with an entire race of Tarrasques as well as Athas-style Dragons, demonspwan, slimes and every kind of monster. The nickname of this sphere is "The Gods' Graveyard".
Infested crystal sphere

Nacrespace (aka Pearlspace) is a flooded crystal sphere. Approximately a third of its total volume consists of air, but the sphere actually resembles a goldfish bowl with a top. The worlds swirl around the central elemental sapphire jewel sun which heats the waters to bearable temperatures.
[central campaign setting for BTFS campaign]
Origin of Witchlight Marauders, 5 months from Casaspace
Formally frozen, comet-filled sphere (aka. Icespace).
Cluster of 6 spheres
It is named for the light blue color of the sky. This is due to the millions of Blue stars that light up the dark regions of the sphere.
The home sphere of the Atridae, a race of dragonfly creatures. Sealed by the Juna, it can only be reached by the use of an Ethereal Key.
The Nuthutch as it has been unkindly called
A member of the Pentiacate
A member of the Pentiacate
It is named for the rainbow colored stars that line the sphere.
'Geode' sphere with no planets. A member of the Pentiacate
It is named so because of the difficult time sailors have in finding it.
Scro Home Sphere

Upon entering Rainspace the spacefarer will immediately understand the naming of this sphere. It is alway raining even in the depths of wildspace. One of the planets called Zenuvia is famous for its gargantuan flytraps capable of swallowing small spelljammers!
Dead sphere
Its name comes from the destroyed planet of Nex which had such terrible evil upon it.
From Under the Dark Fist, use Council of Wyrms setting for Dragonworld
From Under the Dark Fist
From Under the Dark Fist
It is the central headquarters for the Commonrule. It gets its name from the great portal that transports ships to Outspace.
It gets its name for it is the sphere where all the best technologies and craftsmen come to learn, trade, and sell. he
It is named for the great weakened fissure that leads to Temporal Prime somewhere within the sphere.
(aka. Nexspace)
It is named for a hero of the Kr'r'r confrontation, the Dark Ranger Bloodstar, brother to Firestorm, who was essential in the salvation of Roaving Star.
Cubespace is a small sphere that gets it's name from it's central sun, which is oddly enough in the shape of a giant cube.
It is called such because of the planet Sword, and the two great starbeasts who will someday use planets Sword and Helm to fight.
Goblin sphere conquered by scro

There are two primary governmental factions warring for control of the sphere. The first faction is the Duntharan Empire--Hurmus, Stattoo, and Agmar. Consists primarily of humans and demi-humans allied to stop the conquest of their enemies. The second faction is the Volarin Empire--Grothag, Calim, and Tallin. Consists primarily of Viking Beserkers who seek relentlessly to conquer the sphere.
From Under the Dark Fist
From Under the Dark Fist

Jadespace is one of the older known Spheres. Ancient artifacts of the Juna can still be found within the crystal sphere. It is one of the most diverse spheres known for all walks of life and any know spelljamming race can be found here.
Webspace is actually two spheres in one. Both co-exist with one another, seperated by a magical curtain
Webspace is actually two spheres in one. Both co-exist with one another, seperated by a magical curtain
Dark & Dangerous Sphere

It is named due to upon entering the sphere, one appears in the orbit of Gainiiaaon. The crystal shell is actually a month away, toward the Wee One, at spelljamming speed. Portals open within Gainiiaaon to allow for exit. also known as Compspace.
Features in "The Broken Sphere" (TCMC5 p.16)
Contains Falx (PP), Sunset World (Dragon #150), Pharagos (Dungeon #100)
From Under the Dark Fist
From Under the Dark Fist
From Under the Dark Fist
It is named so because of the great seas of air that float through space. (aka Cloudspace)
The system is thick with stray gasses, which makes it impossible to see another of the worlds unless it is close enough, or 'in phase.'
Giant-dominated sphere
This is the homesphere of all giant races. Each planet houses grand civilizations comprised solely of that species of giants.
Nexspace is a sphere mentioned in the Cloakmaster Cycle. TCMC5 p.90
Winterspace is a sphere mentioned of in the Cloakmastercycle. Telden must travel with the elves through Armistice and Radole.

column15: Cidadel of the Keepers of the Flame
column83: Human worlds on major trade routes, mentioned in TCMC2 p.10
This sphere has many glowing rings of world spanning size.They come in many different colors.
Home of spacefaring minotaur empire
Small, planetless sphere with many asteroid belts
Mentioned in SJR1 Lost Ships. A mostly deserted, dangereous sphere
Illithids capital sphere - still recovering from massive damage suffered during the vodani war.
From Under the Dark Fist
From Under the Dark Fist
Reptilian sphere
At war with Thuriaspace
It is named so for its central planet, Prime. Teldin visits a mechantile post in the outskirts of the sphere in The Broken Sphere.
From The Broken Sphere (p.214)
Astromundi Cluster capaign setting
Krynnspace is a sphere made for the Dragonlance Campaign World.
Shadowspace (from Heart of the Enemy)
Moragspace is a sphere designed for the Spelljammer module SJS1 "Goblin's Return." Home of Gammaro base.
Faeriespace is a sphere created for the "Crystal Spheres" campaign module SJA3. History can be found there in.
Home of ogre spacefaring fleet
Night sphere
Major Illithid shipbuilding centre
From Under the Dark Fist
An ancient sphere, home to the planet Atlantus?
Rockspace is the most ideal sphere for making dwarven citidels. The great amount of rock on Citadel Maker, Minja, and Toolfyd give it its name.
Part of Gatespace Cluster
Part of Gatespace Cluster

SJA3 Crystal Spheres
Greyspace is a sphere created for the Greyhawk campaign world.
Sphere dominated by Kobolds, Gnolls, and other canine humanoids.
Isolated, few habitable worlds
Another ancient sphere, home of the titans.
Home sphere of the Oortlings
From Under the Dark Fist
Oriental Neogi Empires
Runedarspace has three Wormholes that allow for accelerated travel to other spheres
Mentioned in Dungeon #36 and #45
Arcane controlled sphere designed by Ed Greenwood and found in Dragon #159
Netherese colony sphere
Realmspace is a sphere designed for the campaign world of Forgotten Realms.
Cthulu sphere
Greatspace is a sphere created for the campaign module SJA3 "Crystal Spheres"
Sphere containing the Bandor Cluster.

The crystal sphere is much larger than it should be, given that it houses only one celestial body. The entire Crystal Sphere is filled with millions upon millions of iridescent particles. The particles all glow with bright radiance akin to the stars of a night sky. They vary in size from that of a grain of sand to a small asteroid. These particles will pass freely through a ship's air envelope and settle upon the ship itself. When the ship leaves the crystal sphere it will glow with a radiance similar t
Dominated by Thr-Kreen and Xixchil (see Thri-Kreen of Athas p.84)
Setting for Penderyn Campaign
Beltoun to Taul = 45 days, Taul to S'Sirenth = 35 days, Beltoun from Calatain = 35 days, Beltoun to Claatain = 50 days
Elf dominated
Inner surface of sphere is habitable, A member of the Pentiacate
Home sphere of Gromman & Hadozee

Center of the Maelstrom and thus visited by many spelljammers. Twilitespace is both the hub of trade and the center of civilization for the entire Maelstrom. Elves, humans, giants, and goblins were all born in this sphere. also known as Twilightspace.
On Hammer flow, 50 days from S'Sirenth, 35 days from Taul
Small, remote sphere
PC's homeworld in Monsterous Arcana modules
World of Aerofalyn was sacked by Goblinoids during the First Unhuman War.
Herdspace is a sphere mentioned of in the Cloakmastercycle "The Maelstrom's Eye" (TCMC3 p.49).
Huge sphere, Illithid/Gith races home sphere
It receives it's name from the portal which exits ships from Inspace.
IEN home base
Elven dominated sphere from Polyhedron #81

Sphere is briefly mentioned in Dragon Issue 175, page 4. An elven controlled sphere known for its gargantuan thorn worlds Bramble and Briar. Scro and Illithids sometimes attempt to scout it (at great peril) on the assumption it is the choise location for Lionheart. Non-elves are not tolerated within the sphere and a war-clan of loyal Bionoids is always on the ready to help enforce the elven claim. A major resupply station of the IEN is located within the branches of Bramble. Many smaller elven communiti

The "Place of Tears," Tyrspace's civilizations was shaped centuries ago by evil Raer sorcerers, who used it as a testing ground for their experiments. From those experiments were born the centaurs, satyrs, and minotaurs.
This sphere is famous for it's gemstone sun and the homeworld of the dwarves. Countless asteriods, minor worlds, and gas giants are home to numerous and diverse civilizations.

Once the center of the Raer Empire and many relics from that shattered empire remain. The world of Pale is long thought the lost capital of the Raer, but it was nearly destroyed during the Rage of the Emperor. Descendants of the Raer continue to survive but have fallen into barbarism.

A hot, dry sphere that was once the center of a great illithid empire. New civilizations have risen from the ashes of the fallen empire seeking their own destinies. Great danger and incredible wealth awaits those that dare delve into the secrets of Banesun.
aka. Bralspace, Spiralspace, or Morunespace featured in "The Maelstrom's Eye" by Roger E. Moore
column85: Nigel Findley, Adam Miller, Paul Westermeyer

column83: The sphere is named so because anyone born within the sphere is charmed so as to not want to leave.
Water-filled sphere
near 'Malspace
Origin of assoritid psychic worms
It is named for the planets.
Civilization is young in Pearlspace, immigrating from other spheres. Strange and unusual worlds abound, strangest of all the gigantic dragon who's fiery breath lights and heats the whole sphere.

Largest and wildest sphere in the Maelstrom and home to endless herds of kindori and other space-born creatures. The famous Travelling City, built upon the back of a gigantic, space-travelling whale ten miles long, wanders this sphere.

column85: Adam Miller, Paul Westermeyer, Rian McMurty

column83: Example sphere
Near illithid territories
Pirate Activity
(aka. Coldspace)
Dirkspace is named for its three planets that look very akin to blades.

Racespace is a sphere that was started many millenia ago. It was hoped that humans and demihumans could get along if they shared a sphere but kept to their own planets. Unfortunetly, they were forgotten.
35 days inside innerflow (to, 36 days from)

column85: Adam Miller, Paul Westermeyer, Rian McMurty
Adam Miller, Paul Westermeyer, Rian McMurty

column83: Home of Rhymchaeld campign
Home of Maginca campaign world
Birthright Sphere
Its name comes from the unusual noise that every sailor can hear while in the sphere.

This sphere is home to the greatest of Wyrm-sages, Ocrattafarsmythe, a Golden Great Wyrm. It was given to him as a gift from a dragon god with the understanding that he must aid any dragon kind which came to him for wisdom. There is a direct portal to this sphere located in every Crystal Sphere that has a "dragon" constellation in it.
Sphere containing a giant tree

The sphere holds the Talangran Empire, a spelljamming aware groundling nation with superior technology and a thirst for Elven slaves. In my campaign the Talangran Empire has begun to expand into the stars. Inspired by "The Lady Rose" Dungeon #39(?)
Wayspace is a sphere mentioned during the Spelljammer book series. Teldin says that he comes from Lyi in Wayspace, which is a farming colony. This sphere comes from book 2.

Due to the prescence of the many fire bodies of the sphere the temperature of the void is considerably higher than in any other sphere. It borders on uncomfortable near the shell and as a vessel draws near the center it becomes impossible to endure without protection.
It receives its name in that the chaos emeralds come from this sphere.
Its name was given due to the Great Expansion of 175BR when spelljammers charged into the sphere. It is a sphere of mercinaries and law.

What is Dungeonsphere? Dungeonsphere is the largest dungeon in all of known space. The size of this dungeon is not measured easily. Why is this? This is because Dungeonsphere is not on a planet, it is within a crystal sphere. So it is just on a large planet then? No it is the crystal sphere itself.
It is named so because of the antimagic effects of the planet's atmospheres. Spelljammers who enter these atmospheres... fall.
Mystaran Cluster: Inner Sphere (Near Mystara)
Wemic-controlled sphere in the Black Flow
Aka: Ragespace
Oriental-themed sphere
D&D Setting World
Home of Fritz Lieber's Lanhkmar - water filled, planets are bubbles

Each of the planets in this sphere houses many civilizations of brownie-like humanoids. These tiny beings mimic the many races of a large world, but are only a few inches tall at most. The geography of the planets is tiny as well, with the tallest mountains being several hundered feet tall at most. A tree would stand approximately a foot or two at most. "Normal" characters are verifiable titans to these people, and may not even notice the tiny people which exist on the surface of these worlds.
It is named so because of the thousands of small live bearing asteroids scattered throughout the sphere. A great vacation spot or retirement land.
Home of Draconia campaign setting
Trailspace (aka Pathspace) is named for the path the great planet takes within the sphere.
Worlds from 'Bard's Tale' computer games
Taslanta -based sphere
Fae sphere
Fae sphere
Another ancient sphere, home of the titans.
Home to Lizardmen and Insect races
The world of the Thieves' World anthologies is in this sphere. I think the Nisibis, at least, are Spelljammer aware.
Runequest Campaign World
Located away from any major rivers this was only recently discovered by an Elven Man-o-War. Only artifact level magic (like Helms) and spells up to 2nd level function here.
Home sphere of the Harmonium faction (Planescape)
Bronze Age Sphere
Aztec Sphere

Accessing this sphere from the flow is easy, however, leaving it can prove to be difficult. There are numerous one-way portals leading out of the sphere within the constellations of the Crystal Shell. The locations of these portals shift and change randomly from star to star.

Latierraspace is mainly held by the spelljamming fleet of Amnestriosti, which is also unusually large (somewhere around 3000 ships...), but the other planets have some monopolies on the Spelljamming market.
Setting for Movie 'Krull'
'Flash Gordan' sphere
It recieves its name due to the great amounts of sand that are scattered throughout space, causing fearce storms and undue wear and tear on spelljamming vessels.

Its name was derived by the EIN inorder to easily allow diplomats and forien dignitaries to find the correct planets durring times of peace and truce. Countspace is the heart of the Elven Imperial Navy.
Ancient Egyptian-style sphere

It should not be allowed to exist unless the Church Clerics Campaign adaption is being used.

This sphere uses the Earth at the center of the system organization and repesents our Solarsystem as it was believed to be during the Darkages. However, magic works. Some individuals are aware of spelljamming. Use the Age of Charlemange and Vikings History
Near Krynn, or Wyrmspace (Krynn II)

This sphere, the only of its kind to actually spelljam like a ship, has a sun that was made by the Vorshaks. Using the helm destroys all planetary bodies within a sphere.
The sphere Krynn got moved to
Between Grinspace and Dehmpridum
